Class CoordDescNNQP

java.lang.Object
heparansulfate.CoordDescNNQP
public class CoordDescNNQP extends Object
Solution to nonnegative quadratic programming: minimize (1/2)x^TQx + c^Tx subject to x >= 0 via coordinate descent. Note that Q must be symmetric and positive definite

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    int
    iter
    Keeps track of the number of iterations (1 iter == change of all components x_1, x_2, ..., x_n)
    double[]
    optimum
    Optimal value of x.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CoordDescNNQP(double[][] Q, double[] c, double[] y)
    Solves: minimize (1/2)x^TQx + c^Tx subject to x >= 0.

  • Field Details

    • iter

      public int iter
      Keeps track of the number of iterations (1 iter == change of all components x_1, x_2, ..., x_n)

    • optimum

      public double[] optimum
      Optimal value of x.

  • Constructor Details

    • CoordDescNNQP

      public CoordDescNNQP(double[][] Q, double[] c, double[] y)
      Solves: minimize (1/2)x^TQx + c^Tx subject to x >= 0. Solution x is in this.optimum
      Parameters:
      Q - coefficients of the quadratic terms in the cost function.
      c - coefficients of the linear terms in the cost function.
      y - starting point (any random point in the positive orthant).
